title: I once had a Twitch...
body:
I once had a Twitch in ranked as Leona. He had dc'd for the first five minutes.

I was left in bot lane, with the occasional gank from Jarvan who was raging at the missing ADC. Despite this, I managed to secure First Blood on their Quinn, and was feeling pretty comfortable. Once Twitch made it back into the game, he had admitted that his computer had crashed on him during loading, and was pretty apologetic. I wasn't mad and didn't rage, since I had made their bot lane's lives pretty miserable by this point. I simply told him to farm to catch up, and let me worry about the enemy. Sure enough, as soon as they spotted the level 1 Twitch, they tried to focus him, only to meet one VERY p*ssed-off Mama Leona. I score a kill on Sona with Twitch getting a kill on Quinn about a minute later. By this point, even Jarvan was hopeful about this game, and I turned into a juggernaut with my first death coming around the 13 minute mark. By the end, we had turned a 4v5 into a 5v5 pubstomp, and Twitch was very appreciative of his support. 

To think that this was in Bronze 5... Now, if only more games as support in this tier went as good, I might enjoy ranked more.

The lesson here is: Don't rage at the guy who DC'd at the start, unless they did it to be a d*ck. There's still hope.

As long as they reconnect early enough for it not to really matter.

Match details: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1743437444/36027185?tab=overview

After reconnecting, my team was super friendly and I was of course, very apologetic. My team said that "they were hoping I would be back" and I was. There was no negativity. And we ended up winning and I landed a lot of my bubbles since my team was not raging. It was a great experience.

I once came in 15 minutes into a game after a series of really bad crashes. I was playing Vayne. My team was super chill and just defended base while I farmed up starting from a 9 level disadvantage, give or take. 

I actually managed to carry the game-- only because my teammates let me build up and covered for my late entry. They let me farm lanes that got into 3rd turret, they fed me kills, they covered for me when I was out of position, they warded like mad. Positive energy was the name of the game, and they let me become the late game monster that Vayne can become and then peeled for me through every positioning mistake. We won a bunch of team fights and eventually the game; a hard earned but well deserved (at least for my team) victory. 

This was with mid gold players for the record. No game is ever hopeless from a setback with or without a skill difference.

Nice job. support vs the world lanes are sometimes interesting, if you can goad them into diving you early so you can snowball.

I have a more cynical story: I was smurfing and my adc dc'd for the first 10 minutes. Lane went alright, I got a level advantage and made some trades and slowly won lane... and then my adc came back, saw the enemies I'd softened up, and immediately tower dove at level 1. Over and over and over. After being baited into tower diving multiple times, he finally hit level 2, and tower dove some more.

No moral to this, just... don't smurf unless you're hurting for ridiculous stories to tell.

Well I mean... okay, good job I'm glad it didn't ruin the game for you... but what you're saying is you fought an incredibly incompetent bronze 5 enemy bot lane and won. Leona can't 1v2  a bot lane that's remotely close to the same skill level...
